column2: Purdue researcher to receive national honor at White House on Friday
column3: Nancy Ho, founder and president of Green Tech America Inc., and a research professor emerita in Purdue Universityâ€™s School of Chemical Engineering, will receive the National Medal of Technology and Innovation from President Barack Obama at 2:30 p.m. (EST) Friday (Jan. 22).

column2: Concerts, competitions, special events to enliven Purdue Jazz Festival
column3: More than 90 big bands and combos from high schools and middle schools across the state of Indiana and Midwest have been accepted to compete in the 26th Purdue Jazz Festival in West Lafayette on Jan. 23.

column2: 'GIRLRISING' film showing at Purdue Jan. 27
column3: 'Girl Rising,' a film about how education can improve girls' lives, will be featured at Purdue University on Wednesday (Jan. 27).

column2: Black History Month video series on singing, peace and justice
column3: A February film series at Purdue University will focus on singing for peace and justice by featuring the lives of Paul Robeson, Pete Seeger and Joan Baez.

column2: Science on Tap talk to discuss links between symptoms of mental illness and changes in brain activity
column3: Purdue University clinical psychology professor Daniel Foti will headline the next Science on Tap with a talk discussing how different types of brain activity are affected in illnesses such as depression and schizophrenia.

column2: Supply chain topic of Jan. 29 management conference
column3: The Global Supply Chain Management Initiative Spring Conference, presented by Purdue University's Krannert School of Management, is Jan. 29. The event is 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. in Purdue Memorial Union North and South ballroom.

column2: Center for the Environment, College of Agriculture to host Ideas Lab on research for ag-related technologies in food security
column3: Purdue University's Center for the Environment, in partnership with the College of Agriculture, will lead an effort aimed at generating innovative interdisciplinary research proposals for new agricultural technologies in food security.

column2: Galleries exhibit explores still, moving images
column3: Purdue University Galleries will offer 'Still Moving' Jan. 25 through Feb. 5 in the Patti and Rusty Rueff Galleries in Yue-Kong Pao Hall, 552 W. Wood St.

column2: Pork conference addresses animal health, nutrition
column3: Pork producers will get the latest information on animal health, nutrition and other vital topics at the Southern Indiana Pork Conference.

column2: Harpeth Rising brings 'chambergrass' to Lafayette
column3: The violin, banjo and cello shall come together to form Harpeth Rising, a 'chambergrass' trio that will blend folk, rock, classical and newgrass with performances on Feb. 5 and Feb. 6 at 7 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. each evening.

column2: Dairy producers announce regional meetings
column3: Purdue Extension and Indiana Dairy Producers are hosting a series of regional meetings for dairy producers and industry professionals throughout the state.

column2: Musical 'Annie' to be performed at Purdue on Feb. 11
column3: The U.S. national tour of 'Annie,' directed by lyricist and director Martin Charnin for the 19th time, will take to the stage at 7 p.m. Feb. 11 at Purdue's Elliott Hall of Music.

column2: 'Junie B. Jones' family show to perform on Valentine's Day at Purdue
column3: This Valentine's Day, find out everything you need to know about school with 'Junie B.'s Essential Survival Guide to School,' which will be written at 3 p.m. on Feb. 14 in Purdue's Loeb Playhouse. This performance is presented by Purdue Convocations.

column2: Seminar to give farmers new insights into land leasing
column3: Purdue Extension is offering a seminar that will help farmers with land leasing decisions at a time of tight profit margins.

column2: Farmers Market Forum Feb. 19 in Indianapolis
column3: Purdue Extension's Local Foods Program is continuing to help farmers markets improve their marketing and better understand government regulations through the Indiana Farmers Market Forum.

column2: LGBTQ and ally student-led conference to bring Judy Shepard, speakers, entertainers to Purdue
column3: The Crossroad Coalition, a Purdue University student organization, is hosting the Midwest Bisexual, Lesbian, Gay, Transgender, Ally College Conference 2016: Introspection at the Crossroads on Feb. 19-21.

column2: Books and Coffee talks explore new, popular literary works
column3: Purdue University professors will discuss four contemporary books during the Books and Coffee series. The discussions are sponsored by the Department of English and Purdue Student Union Board.

column2: Winter webinars cover ag production, marketing topics
column3: Purdue Extension is offering a series of weekly webinars in coming months to provide beginning farmers and operators of small farms with practical information on a range of agricultural production and agribusiness topics.

column2: Panic! At The Disco to perform April 14 at Purdue
column3: Panic! At The Disco will perform at 7:30 p.m. April 14 at Purdue University's Elliott Hall of Music. This performance is presented by the Purdue Student Concert Committee with support from the Student Fee Advisory Board.

column2: Business leaders visit Purdue for Krannert Executive Forum
column3: Leading business executives and entrepreneurs will visit Purdue University over the next four months for the Krannert School of Management Executive Forum. It features top-level executives and community leaders sharing their experiences.

column2: Purdue events planned to celebrate Martin Luther King Jr.
column3: Several activities at Purdue University this month will celebrate the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

column2: State conference on STEM education comes to Purdue campus
column3: The latest work in STEM education and research is the focus of a state conference at Purdue University.

column2: Award-winning accordionist to participate in Chinese New Year Celebrations at Purdue
column3: Tian Jianan will bring the bayan, a chromatic button-keyboard accordion, to the Purdue Memorial Union South Ballroom at 8 p.m. Jan. 30 to celebrate the Chinese New Year.

column2: Marketing workshop aims to help farmers build sales
column3: Purdue Extension and the North Central Sustainable Agriculture Research and Education program are offering Marketing for Success, a daylong workshop to help farmers build their businesses through direct marketing.

column2: Academy to focus on management in seed industry
column3: Leadership techniques for the long-term success of seed companies will be at the forefront when the American Seed Trade Association Management Academy begins March 7 in West Lafayette.

column2: Expert leads cattle handling seminar for beef producers
column3: Indiana beef producers and veterinarians are invited to attend a beef cattle handling seminar sponsored by Purdue University's Integrated Resource Management program.

column2: Women's entrepreneurship program to host events in Lafayette, Indianapolis
column3: Women who have an interest in entrepreneurship, innovation and collaboration are invited to attend two events to help them attain their goals.

column2: Free classroom business workshop open to K-8 teachers
column3: A Jan. 14 workshop at Purdue will focus on how to start a classroom business. The free workshop will provide teachers step-by-step instructions on creating a student business applying Indiana social studies, math and language arts standards.

column2: Learn new techniques, technologies in crop workshops
column3: Purdue Extension's Pest Management Programs will host a series of crop management workshops during January at four sites throughout Indiana.

column2: Learn how to raise shrimp in one-day workshop
column3: Purdue Extension and the Indiana Aquaculture Association are offering a one-day workshop on raising marine shrimp.

column2: Purdue Galleries to feature 'Sixty Square Inches' and '360 Degrees of Separation'
column3: Purdue University Galleries will open two new group exhibits of small printmaking and international ceramics on Jan. 11 and 12.

column2: Purdue experts to lead sessions at Fort Wayne Farm Show
column3: Purdue Extension specialists in weed control and agricultural economics will present informational sessions at the Fort Wayne Farm Show Jan. 12-14.

column2: Indiana Horticultural Congress Jan. 19-21
column3: Produce farmers and agritourism operators are invited to attend Purdue Extension's Indiana Horticultural Congress and Trade Show Jan. 19-21.

column2: Alumna, Catholic Relief Services head keynotes winter commencement
column3: Purdue alumna Carolyn Yauyan Woo, a former University of Notre Dame dean and current president and CEO of Catholic Relief Services, was the keynote speaker during Purdue's winter commencement ceremonies on Dec. 20.

column2: DIVA Jazz Orchestra to take part in Purdue Jazz Festival
column3: The annual Purdue Jazz Festival will kick off its 26th year with a performance by the DIVA Jazz Orchestra at 8 p.m. Jan. 22 at Loeb Playhouse. This performance is presented by Purdue Convocations.

column2: Conference to bring women in ag together for education, networking
column3: Women in all sectors of agriculture will be offered educational and networking opportunities at the 15th Annual Midwest Women in Agriculture Conference.

column2: Purdue STEM event shows off middle school exergame inventions
column3: Middle school students will demonstrate their exercise game innovations during a showcase Thursday (Dec. 10) at Purdue University.

column2: Purdue Extension to host dairy nutrition update
column3: Purdue Extension will be the host of a dairy nutrition workshop focused on helping dairy cattle producers learn about the updates in nutrition made this year.

column2: Hyperloop Technologies expert to lecture during Purdue class on Hyperloop design
column3: A group of Purdue University students will participate in a SpaceX Hyperloop pod competition to help design test vehicles for a vacuum-tube transit system proposed by inventor and business magnate Elon Musk.

column2: Purdue students to compete for more than $10,000 in media tech contest
column3: More than 15 teams of Purdue graduate and undergraduate students across all academic disciplines will compete Thursday (Dec. 10) in the sixth Schurz Innovation Challenge at Purdue.

column2: Freeman Hrabowski, president of University of Maryland, Baltimore County, to speak at Purdue Martin Luther King Jr. celebration
column3: Freeman A. Hrabowski III, president of the University of Maryland, Baltimore County, on Jan. 19 will keynote the Purdue University celebration of the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The theme of the 2016 celebration is The Fierce Urgency of Now.

column2: Illiana Vegetable Growers Symposium set for Jan. 5
column3: Commercial vegetable farmers and market gardeners will have networking opportunities and get tips on how to improve their business when they meet at the Illiana Vegetable Growers Symposium.

column2: Purdue Dance Company to present Winter Works concert
column3: The Purdue Contemporary Dance Company will present its Winter Works 2015 dance concert Dec. 11-12.

column2: Purdue Memorial Union ushers in holiday season
column3: The holiday season at Purdue University will begin at approximately 12:30 p.m. Monday (Dec. 7) when the 27-foot-tall Christmas tree arrives at the Memorial Union's Great Hall.

column2: Purdue Extension workshop to focus on retirement, estate management
column3: Purdue Extension is offering families a chance to learn more about retirement and estate management during two-day workshops at five Indiana locations starting in January.

column2: Extension webinar offers guidance on farm rents
column3: Experts from the Purdue Center for Commercial Agriculture will lead a webinar Dec. 8 to help farmers determine how to balance the costs of long-term cash rents with declining operating revenue.

column2: Purdue Extension Master Cattleman program starts Dec. 1
column3: Purdue Extension is offering a 10-session program to help beef producers improve the profitability of their operations through effective farm management.

column2: ARA Management Academy to sharpen leadership skills
column3: Leaders within agronomic organizations can sharpen their management and decision-making skills at the 2016 Agricultural Retailers Association Management Academy Feb. 2-4 in West Lafayette.

column2: Purdue Graduate Student Government to host Free Speech forum Dec. 1
column3: Purdue Graduate Student Government, with support from the Office of the President, on Dec. 1 will host 'What is Free Speech?' a discussion forum that will focus on the 'Chicago principles' on academic freedom and freedom of expression.
